sentences.en: Electronic retailing has predictably become known as etailing.
sentences.cn: 正如所料，electronicretailing（网络零售业务）已经被称为etailing。

sentences.en: Hawaiians, perhaps predictably, developed a pizza with a pineapple and ham topping.
sentences.cn: 夏威夷人, 或许一想就知道, 发展出一种上面覆着凤梨和火腿的披萨.

sentences.en: His article is, predictably, a scathing attack on capitalism.
sentences.cn: 可想而知，他的文章是对资本主义的严厉抨击。

sentences.en: I asked the boss for a rise and his reply was predictably short and sweet!
sentences.cn: 我要求老板增加我的工资,他的回答如意料的一样,简单明了!

sentences.en: It's also sapped, predictably, by alcohol, lack of sleep and stress.
sentences.cn: 我们还可以预期, 自控力会因为酒精 、 缺少睡眠和压力而削弱.

sentences.en: Predictably the winter will be snowy, sleety and slushy.
sentences.cn: 预计冬天将会雨雪纷飞,泥泞不堪.

sentences.en: PredictaBly the winter will Be snowy, sleety and slushy.
sentences.cn: 估计今年冬天将雨雪纷飞、泥泞不堪.

sentences.en: Predictably, he did not like the news.
sentences.cn: 可以预见的是, 他不喜欢这条消息.

sentences.en: Predictably, he left his umbrella in the train.
sentences.cn: 如所预料, 他把雨伞遗留在火车上.

sentences.en: Predictably, it will split and fall apart by and by, though it may not crumble instantly.
sentences.cn: 它虽不至于立即瓦解, 但分崩离析的窘境, 恐怕是难以避免的.

sentences.en: Predictably, the plans have been controversial.
sentences.cn: 可以预料的是这些规划存在争议.

sentences.en: Predictably, they objected to anything they saw as rocking the boat.
sentences.cn: 可以预见的是, 他们反对一切自认为是扰乱现状的事情.

sentences.en: The central London hospitals have reacted predictably.
sentences.cn: 伦敦各主要医院的反应皆在预料之中。

sentences.en: The subversion attempt proved predictably futile.
sentences.cn: 颠覆的企图毫无悬念的被证实无效.

words.tran_cn: 作出预言；作预料，作预报

trans.tran_cn: 可预见地，果不出所料地，脱不出老一套地
